description:
In a world where magic is everything, Asta and Yuno are both found abandoned at a church on the same day. While Yuno is gifted with exceptional magical powers, Asta is the only one in this world without any. At the age of fifteen, both receive grimoires, magic books that amplify their holder’s magic. Asta’s is a rare Grimoire of Anti-Magic that negates and repels his opponent’s spells. Being opposite but good rivals, Yuno and Asta are ready for the hardest of challenges to achieve their common dream: to be the Wizard King. Giving up is never an option!

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: แบล็กโคลเวอร์

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Class Struggle
tags.description: Contains conflict born between the different social classes. Generally between an dominant elite and a suffering oppressed group.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Elf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an elf.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Cult
tags.description: Features a social group with unorthodox religious, spiritual, or philosophical beliefs and practices.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: Cultivation
tags.description: Features characters using training, often martial arts-related, and other special methods to cultivate qi (a component of traditional Chinese philosophy, described as "life force") and gain strength or immortality.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Nun
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a nun.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Espionage
tags.description: Prominently features characters infiltrating an organization in order to steal sensitive information.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Dungeon
tags.description: Prominently features a dungeon environment.

tags.name: Curses
tags.description: Features a character, object or area that has been cursed, usually by a malevolent supernatural force.

node.description: __Yuuki Tabata__ is a Japanese mangaka, who was previously an assistant under [Toshiaki Iwashiro](https://anilist.co/staff/98048/ToshiakiIwashiro) & [Ryuuhei Tamura](https://anilist.co/staff/102375/RyuuheiTamura).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/325492584) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=tatsuya_yoshihara)

Freelance animator formerly affiliated with [Actas](https://anilist.co/studio/60/) where he was attending its internal animation school and debuted as animator at the age of 20. His work has been greatly influenced by contemporary Kanada school animators [Seiya Numata](https://anilist.co/staff/124320/) and [Hironori Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/103979/). 

He's a precocious talent, debuting as episode director at the age of 21 and as director at the age of 23 with [Arve Rezzle](https://anilist.co/anime/13863/), as part of the Young Animator Training Project.

Married to fellow animator [Kikuko Sadakata](https://anilist.co/staff/105769).

__[Website](https://www.miyunamiyuna.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/miyunasinger)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLZ2RXLLVx0jAl0jxe7QzyQ)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/miyuna_miyuna/)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/miyuna67/)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/2eg5oiMWKYEJ5vVwW1YFCC?)__

__Date of Birth:__ June 7, 2002
__Birthplace:__ Miyazaki Prefecture, Japan

__Introduction:__
Miyuna is a Japanese singer-songwriter affiliated with record label [A.S.A.B](https://www.asab.online/) (2019-), while having previously been under record label [Here, play pop!](http://www.playpop.org/) since her debut in 2018. 

__Biography:__
Miyuna became familiar with the rock, soul and pop genre from early childhood, which is particularily due to her parents playing western music during travels. Her parents would often listen to Whitney Houston and Michael Jackson, and as a result she became interested in soul and pop type music. She has also mentioned that her grandmother liked the artist [Hibari Misora](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hibari_Misora).

In elementary school Miyuna started listening to [ONE OK ROCK](https://anilist.co/staff/126954/ONE-OK-ROCK) and became interested in rock, specifically full-fledged rock. Continuing her descent into rock, in junior high school she started listening to the rock band [coldrain](https://anilist.co/staff/105449/Coldrain), which bloomed an interest in more sub-genres of rock. She also seems to listen to various artists, regardless of genre - as an example she mentioned that she has listened to [Kouji Tamaki](https://anilist.co/staff/112133), [Toshinobu Kubota](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toshinobu_Kubota), [Ringo Shiina](https://anilist.co/staff/103213/Ringo-Shiina), the band [Petrolz](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%83%9A%E3%83%88%E3%83%AD%E3%83%BC%E3%83%AB%E3%82%BA) (stylized as PETROLZ), [Yu Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/116399/Yu-Takahashi), [Nakamura Emi](https://anilist.co/staff/138586/NakamuraEmi) and VOCALOID-type stuff.

She initially found success with her first two singles, "[Gamushara](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TciQvQFTzHo)" and "[Tenjou Tenge](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fZK5LKN4tek)", which were used as the fifth opening and ending theme songs to the anime [Black Clover](https://anilist.co/anime/97940/Black-Clover/). Her third single, "[Boku to Kimi no Lullaby](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GH7cWANydnQ)" was used as the twenty-fifth ending theme song to the anime [Fairy Tail](https://anilist.co/anime/6702/Fairy-Tail/), or alternatively known as the third ending theme song to the 2018 season of [Fairy Tail](https://anilist.co/anime/99749/Fairy-Tail-2018/), and the fourth single, "[Yurareru](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wOAz7xkukrY)", was used as the theme song for the 2019 Japanese remake of the Korean film Blind. She continues to release demos for her songs on the independent Japanese music platform Eggs.

(Source: [Wikipedia (EN)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miyuna), edited)

__Height:__ 155 cm (5'1")
__Nicknames:__ ハンメグ (Hanmegu), グミたん (Gumi-tan), 潘ちゃん (Han-chan)
__Hobbies:__ Making sweets, Hitokara (solo karaoke)

[Profile (Atomic Monkey)](http://www.atomicmonkey.jp/jp/archives/talent/megumihan) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/meg-han/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/han_meg_han) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/32248.html) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/han_meg_han/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/megumihanfans) | [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/meghanmeg.bsky.social) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Megumi_Han) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/潘めぐみ)

Megumi Han is the daughter of voice actress [Keiko Han](https://anilist.co/staff/95760). She debuted as a actress in the 2008 live-action film _Sakura no Sono_ prior to debuting as a seiyuu in the 2011 broadcast of _Hunter x Hunter_. According to Han, _Hunter x Hunter_ was the first manga series she bought in elementary school.

(Source: MyAnimeList)

__[Website](https://vickeblanka.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/VickeBlanka)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/vickeblanka)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/vickeblanka/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCWDksMO8R0Mew4B89GhO9dA)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0PYPjvZaOa7bsCq26JOX8d)__ | __[Line](https://timeline.line.me/user/_daxTTMx3-KSyhf9YSLtl4q4KzB8TWXlrqLzGV2I)__

__Biography:__
Junya Yamaike, better known by his stage name Vickeblanka, is a versatile guitarist, pianist, vocalist, lyricist and composer under record label avex trax. His songs are best characterized by his individuality, good melodies and his beautiful falsetto voice. 

He started composing music when he was in elementary school, which drove him to pursue music as a career, and as a result he decided to attend university in Tokyo. In 2016, he was finally able to debut. Since his debut, his performances have impressed the audience, making him one of the must-see musicians in the up and coming music scene.

__[Website](https://itowokashi.jp/) | [Twitter (Kashitaro)](https://twitter.com/kashitaro_ito) | [Twitter (Ryo)](https://twitter.com/LeftyMonsterP) | [NicoNico Profile (Kashitaro)](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/25761100) | [NicoNico Profile (Ryo)](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/24882114)__

__Formed:__ 2012
__Genres:__ J-POP

__Introduction:__
Itowokashi is a Japanese two-man unit consisting of utaite Kashitaro Ito and multi-instrumentalist Ryo "Lefty" Miyata who, with their years of talent and experience, perform with characteristic melodies, carefully woven with touching lyrics and a powerful singing voice that values the Japanese language. They are under record label Avex Trax (2016–).

They are somewhat secretive about their identity and will only reveal it during live performances.

__Biography:__
Since their formation in 2012, they have, in parallel with their band activities, been actively engaged in activities such as posting music online, providing music to various artists, participating in various music production, and attending various supporting acts for other musicians. They have in their time as a duo garnered over 25 million video views on video sharing sites such as Nico Nico and YouTube, while also gaining over 550.000 followers on twitter from lots of fans worldwide.

Because they are a band, when they continued to produce music mainly on online video sites, the duo started to wonder if their music was really reaching everyone from the videos they posted online. They started wondering; "Is the song really reaching everyone?", "Is it grateful to everyone?", "Should we start doing live performances? Because we really want to deliver our music directly to our listeners.", "We want to meet all of you and thank you personally". This led to a change, which especially started happening from 2013, where they would start conducting tours all over the country. They wanted to tour the entirety of Japan to give everyone, especially those in urban areas a chance to see them live, and have since successfully toured in every prefecture.

In addition, the duo has performed in world street live tours internationally in Thailand, Singapore, France and The Netherlands. In Singapore they have also performed twice at certain festivals.

__Members:__
- [Kashitaro Ito](https://anilist.co/staff/157028/Kashitaro-Ito) (伊東歌詞太郎) – vocalist, in-charge of lyrics and composition
- [Ryo "Lefty" Miyata](https://anilist.co/staff/180920) (宮田“レフティ”リョウ), more commonly known as LeftyMonsterP – bassist, guitarist, keyboardist and in-charge of arrangement

(Source: [Wikipedia (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%82%A4%E3%83%88%E3%83%B2%E3%82%AB%E3%82%B7), edited)

Full name: Brand-new idol SHiT (Shinsei Kuso Idol, 新生クソアイドル)

A Japanese idol group that was founded in 2015 by their manager Watanabe Junnosuke.

__[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kankakupiero)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kankakupiero)__ | __[Website](http://kankakupiero.jp/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE-JmUzDu8Fsc3E5WgkMn2A)__

__Formed:__ 2013, Osaka Prefecture, Japan
__Genre:__ Rock

__Biography:__
Kankaku Pierrot, alternatively known by their nickname 感エロ (Kan-ero, otherwise translated "Feeling erotic") is a Japanese four-piece rock band under record label Jiji Records (2013-), which is their own independent record label that they founded alongside the band in 2013. The reason for their individual label is due to how they work under a do it yourself memo, which includes creating their own artwork, doing their own mixing and recording everything themselves.

The band made its first appearance in anime performing "[Haruka Mirai](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tf61cA6a-N0)", otherwise known as the first opening to the adaption of [Yuuki Tabata's](https://anilist.co/staff/110063/Yuuki-Tabata) _[Black Clover](https://anilist.co/anime/97940/Black-Clover/)_. They later reappeared to perform "[Rakugaki Page](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WaoF5QTX3Co)", otherwise known as the sixth opening to the same anime, _Black Clover_.

__Members:__
- Takuto Akizuki (秋月琢登) - guitarist
- Kenta Nishio (西尾健太) - drummer
- Daiki Takiguchi (滝口大樹) - bassist
- Naohiro Yokoyama (横山直弘) - vocalist and guitarist.

__Kumi Koda__ is a Japanese singer from Kyoto, known for her urban and R&B songs.

After debuting with the single "Take Back" in December 2000, Koda gained fame in March 2003 when the songs from her seventh single, "Real Emotion/1000 no Kotoba", were used as themes for the video game Final Fantasy X-2. Her popularity grew with the release of her fourth studio album Secret (2005), her sixteenth single "Butterfly" (2005), and her first greatest hits album Best: First Things (2005), reaching the number-three, number-two, and number-one spots respectively.

Though her early releases presented a conservative, quiet image, since as early as 2003 Koda has adopted a sexier and more provocative style. Because of this image, she has become a fashion leader among young women, setting trends such as the ero-kakkoii style. In 2006 and 2007, Oricon named Koda as the top selling artist of the year.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Website](http://www.empire-official.com/)

EMPiRE is an idol group formed on August 23, 2017. It was formed by WACK and avex, is known formerly as Project aW, and features members from the WACK auditions earlier in the year.

__Website | Twitter | Facebook | Instagram | Tumblr__ __Introduction:__ Charm, alternatively known as THE CHARM PARK, is a Korean-American born guitarist, vocalist, lyricist, composer and arranger under record label A.S.A.B (2019–), having previously been under TOWER RECORDS (2015–2017) and rhythm zone (2018). __Biography:__ He emigrated to the US when he was 8 years old, graduating from Berklee College of Music in Boston, where he majored in Guitar. He is a former member of the band Hemenway (2011–2014).

__Genres:__ Hip hop, Jazz (Nu Jazz), Lounge, Techno, House

[Website](https://m-flo.com/)

m-flo is a Japanese three-piece hip-hop group under record label Rhythm Zone, they were originally classmates since elementary school, VERBAL and Taku Takahashi formed the group. Shortly after, LISA joined as the vocalist and the three of them officially debuted as "m-flo."

**Members:**
- [☆Taku](https://anilist.co/staff/173685/) (otherwise known as 高橋拓, ☆Taku Takahashi) - DJ, in-charge of track making, while also in-charge of rap in some songs (1997–)
- Verbal (otherwise known as 류영기, Ryu Young Gi) - MC, in-charge of rap and lyrics (1997–)
- Lisa (otherwise known as 成田・エリザベス・サクラ, Elizabeth Sakura Narita) - vocalist (1997–2002, 2017–)
Website | Twitter | Facebook | Instagram Members: - SAKIKA - Vocals, Guitar - NAGISA - Guitar - MINA - Bass - MIREI - Drums

__Formed:__ 2013, Osaka Prefecture, Japan

__Biography:__
Kankaku Pierrot, alternatively known by their nickname 感エロ (Kan-ero, otherwise translated "Feeling erotic") is a Japanese four-piece rock band under record label Jiji Records (2013-), which is their own independent record label that they founded alongside the band in 2013. The reason for their individual label is due to how they work under a do it yourself memo, which includes creating their own artwork, doing their own mixing and recording everything themselves.

The band made its first appearance in anime performing "[Haruka Mirai](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tf61cA6a-N0)", otherwise known as the first opening to the adaption of [Yuuki Tabata's](https://anilist.co/staff/110063/Yuuki-Tabata) _[Black Clover](https://anilist.co/anime/97940/Black-Clover/)_. They later reappeared to perform "[Rakugaki Page](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WaoF5QTX3Co)", otherwise known as the sixth opening to the same anime, _Black Clover_.

__Members:__
- Takuto Akizuki (秋月琢登) - guitarist
- Kenta Nishio (西尾健太) - drummer
- Daiki Takiguchi (滝口大樹) - bassist
- Naohiro Yokoyama (横山直弘) - vocalist and guitarist.

Affiliated with Mouse.

He is described by his colleagues as someone very efficient with his line work, particularly the speed at which he can make corrections.

七つの大罪 神々の逆鱗

マギ The labyrinth of magic
青の祓魔師 京都不浄王篇
文豪ストレイドッグス
